meanings.definition: The state of being free from danger or threat.
meanings.sent1: The secureness of the fortress ensured the safety of the royal family.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the secureness of my home, knowing I am protected from harm.
meanings.sent3: The secureness of the squirrel's hiding spot made the other animals jealous.
meanings.sent4: Her secureness in her abilities shone through as she confidently tackled the challenge.
meanings.sent5: The secureness of the lock on the gate gave me peace of mind.

meanings.definition: The quality of being certain or reliable.
meanings.sent1: The secureness of his promise reassured me that he would keep his word.
meanings.sent2: The secureness of the foundation of the building made it sturdy and dependable.
meanings.sent3: The secureness of the weather forecast made planning the picnic a breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her secureness in her decision showed in the unwavering look in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The secureness of the bridge's structure made crossing it feel safe and steady.

meanings.definition: The act of making something safe or protected.
meanings.sent1: The secureness of the vault was evident in the thick metal walls and intricate lock.
meanings.sent2: He ensured the secureness of the package by wrapping it carefully in layers of bubble wrap.
meanings.sent3: The secureness of the password protected the sensitive information from unauthorized access.
meanings.sent4: The secureness of the fence around the garden kept the rabbits from munching on the vegetables.
meanings.sent5: She added an extra layer of secureness to the document by encrypting it with a password.
